publication.title: REDCap: Web-based software for all types of data storage and collection editorial

publication.abstract: Research electronic data capture (REDCap) is a novel workflow methodology and software solution designed for rapid development and deployment of electronic data capture tools to support clinical and translational research. We present: (1) a brief description of the REDCap metadata-driven software toolset; (2) detail concerning the capture and use of study-related metadata from scientific research teams; (3) measures of impact for REDCap; (4) details concerning a consortium network of domestic and international institutions collaborating on the project; and (5) strengths and limitations of the REDCap system. REDCap is currently supporting 286 translational research projects in a growing collaborative network including 27 active partner institutions. Â© 2008 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
publication.title: Research electronic data capture (REDCap)-A metadata-driven methodology and workflow process for providing translational research informatics support

summary.description: Secure web application for building and managing online surveys and databases.
summary.name: REDCap
